snippet: They accused the South’s spy agency of denying the 12 women access to legal services, and said that they had obtained power of attorney from the defectors’ families.
abstract: Human rights lawyers in South Korea accuse country's National Intelligence Service of unlawfully detaining 12 female North Korean defectors and of denying them access to legal services and right to voice their intentions; officials in Seoul dismiss accusations, saying women refuse to speak to attorneys because an admission of defection could provoke North Korea into retaliatory persecution against their families.
lead_paragraph: They accused the South’s spy agency of denying the 12 women access to legal services, and said that they had obtained power of attorney from the defectors’ families.

headline.main: North Korean Defectors’ Detention Is Unlawful, Human Rights Lawyers Say
headline.print_headline: North Korean Defectors in a New Legal Tussle
